review.title: A Biomedical Information Extraction Primer for NLP Researchers
review.abstract: Biomedical Information Extraction is an exciting field at the crossroads of Natural Language Processing, Biology and Medicine. It encompasses a variety of different tasks that require application of state-of-the-art NLP techniques, such as NER and Relation Extraction. This paper provides an overview of the problems in the field and discusses some of the techniques used for solving them.

metadata.title: A Biomedical Information Extraction Primer for NLP Researchers

sections.heading: 1 Introduction
sections.text: The explosion of available scientific articles in the field of biomedicine has led to the rise of Biomedical Information Extraction (BioIE). BioIE systems aim to extract information from a wide range of articles, including medical literature, biological literature, electronic health records, etc., that can be used by physicians and researchers in the field. Frequently, the results of BioIE systems are used to help create databases or identify new avenues for research. For example, a ranking of interacting proteins extracted from biomedical literature but not present in existing databases is helpful for researchers to make informed decisions about which protein / gene to further investigate. Interactions between medicines are necessary for clinicians who administer multiple drugs at the same time. A database of diseases, treatments and tests is useful for physicians who consult in complicated medical cases but are absent. The main problems in BioIE are similar to those in information extraction.

sections.heading: 2 Named Entity Recognition and Fact Extraction
sections.text: In fact, most people are able to survive themselves, and they are able to survive themselves, "he said in an interview with The New York Times:" I don't think they are able to survive themselves. "

sections.heading: 3 Relation Extraction
sections.text: In fact, most of them are able to move to another world, in which they are able, in which they are able to assert themselves.

sections.heading: 4 Event Extraction
sections.text: This year it is more than ever before.

sections.heading: 5 Conclusion
sections.text: Some interesting issues such as Pathway Extraction for Biological Systems (Ananiadou et al., 2010), (Rzhetsky et al., 2004) were not discussed. Biomedical Information Extraction is a challenging and exciting field for NLP researchers that requires the application of cutting-edge methods. Traditionally, there has been a dependence on handmade features or sophisticated methods. However, with the advent of deep learning methods, many BioIE tasks are improving through the introduction of deep learning models such as Convolutional Neural Networks and LSTMs, which require a minimum of feature engineering. Rapid progress in developing better systems for BioIE will be extremely helpful for clinicians and researchers in the field of biomedicine.

The method proposed in (Fukuda et al., 1998) for recognition of protein names in text does not require any prepared dictionary.

cal ontologies using NELL (Carlson et al., 2010), which uses a coupled semi-supervised bootstrapping approach to extract facts from text, given an ontology and a small number of “seed” examples for each category.

(Blaschke and Valencia, 2001) was one of the first large scale Information Extraction efforts to study the feasibility of extraction of proteinprotein interactions (such as “protein A activates protein B”) from Biomedical text.
(Bunescu et al., 2006) combine sentence level relation extraction for protein interactions with corpus level statistics.

An approach as in (Zeng et al., 2015) can be used to combine multi-instance learning and distant supervision with a neural architecture.
Event Extraction gained a lot of interest with the availability of an annotated corpus with the BioNLP’09 Shared Task on Event Extraction (Kim et al., 2008).
(Björne et al., 2009) present a pipeline based method that is heavily dependent on dependency parsing.
(Poon and Vanderwende, 2010) note that previous approaches on the task suffer due to the pipeline nature and the propagation of errors.
To counter this, they adopt a joint inference method based on Markov Logic Networks (Richardson and Domingos, 2006) for the same task on BioNLP’09.
Their final system is competitive and comes very close to the system by (Björne et al., 2009) with an average F-Score of 50%.
Some other more recent models for Biomedical Event Extraction include (Riedel and McCallum, 2011), (McClosky et al.
Some other more recent models for Biomedical Event Extraction include (Riedel and McCallum, 2011), (McClosky et al., 2012).
Some interesting problems such as Pathway Extraction for Biological Systems (Ananiadou et al., 2010), (Rzhetsky et al.
, 2010), (Rzhetsky et al., 2004) have not been discussed.

metadata.abstractText: Biomedical Information Extraction is an exciting field at the crossroads of Natural Language Processing, Biology and Medicine. It encompasses a variety of different tasks that require application of state-of-the-art NLP techniques, such as NER and Relation Extraction. This paper provides an overview of the problems in the field and discusses some of the techniques used for solving them.
